intro: Spennera glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular spennera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it its scientific name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Spennera glandulosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
